conclusion: Liquid will flow out from points A, B, and C and interact with baffles to determine which container, D or E, it will flow into.
Starting Points (A, B, C): Liquid flows out from three points at the top, labeled A (orange), B (cyan), and C (pink).
Baffles: There are several colored baffles (orange, white, purple, yellow, cyan) angled to redirect the flow of liquid.
Containers (D, E): At the bottom, there are two containers: D (left, orange) and E (right, brown).
Orange Baffle (below A): Slants downward to the left.
Cyan Baffle (below B and C): Slants downward to the left.
White Baffle (middle left): Slants downward to the right.
Purple Baffle (below white baffle): Slants downward to the right.
Yellow Baffle (middle right): Slants downward to the left.

premise: Liquid from A falls straight down onto the orange baffle directly below it.
conclusion: The orange baffle slants downward to the left, so the liquid slides to the left end of the baffle.

premise: From the left end of the orange baffle, the liquid falls straight down.
conclusion: It lands on the white baffle, which slants downward to the right.

premise: The liquid slides to the right along the white baffle and falls off its right end.
conclusion: From the right end of the white baffle, the liquid falls straight down.

premise: It lands on the purple baffle, which also slants downward to the right.
conclusion: The liquid slides further to the right and falls off the right end of the purple baffle.

premise: Falling straight down from the right end of the purple baffle, the liquid lands in container E (the right container).
conclusion: Liquid from A ends up in container E.

premise: Liquid from B falls straight down onto the cyan baffle directly below it.
conclusion: The cyan baffle slants downward to the left, so the liquid slides to the left end of the baffle.

premise: From the left end of the cyan baffle, the liquid falls straight down.
conclusion: It lands on the white baffle, which slants downward to the right.
